pos: noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru
noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru

lessons.japanese: あの若夫婦は今でも親におんぶに抱っこだ。
lessons.indonesian: That young couple are still tied to their parent's apron strings.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は赤ん坊をおんぶしていた。
lessons.indonesian: She carried a baby on her back.

lessons.japanese: 日本の女性は赤ん坊を背中におんぶする。
lessons.indonesian: Japanese women carry their babies on their backs.

lessons.japanese: 日本の女性は赤ん坊を背中におんぶする。
lessons.indonesian: Japanese women carry their babies on their backs.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は赤ん坊をおんぶしていた。
lessons.indonesian: She carried a baby on her back.

lessons.japanese: あの若夫婦は今でも親におんぶに抱っこだ。
lessons.indonesian: That young couple are still tied to their parent's apron strings.

lessons.japanese: パパ、もう歩けないよ！ねえ、おんぶして！
lessons.indonesian: I can't walk anymore, Dad! Carry me please!

lessons.japanese: パパ、もう歩けないよ！ねえ、おんぶして！
lessons.indonesian: I can't walk anymore, Dad! Carry me please!

lessons.japanese: パパ、もう歩けないよ！ねえ、おんぶして！
lessons.indonesian: Daddy, I can't walk any more. Could you give me a piggyback ride?

lessons.japanese: パパ、もう歩けないよ！ねえ、おんぶして！

lessons.indonesian: Daddy, I can't walk any more. Could you give me a piggyback ride?

lessons.japanese: パパ、もう歩けないよ！ねえ、おんぶして！
lessons.indonesian: Daddy, I can't walk any more. Carry me.

lessons.japanese: 子供たちをおんぶしてました。
lessons.indonesian: We carried our children on our backs.
